q: You saw the filibuster, now read the book. The 8 1/2- hour speech given by Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., on Dec. 10 decrying proposed tax cuts is being published by Nation Books as The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class, Bernie Sanders announced Wednesday. The book is to become available in mid-February, while an e-book edition will be available Jan. 28, Nation Books said in a news release. The speech is being published in its

producer Cecile Frot-Coutaz says Idol isn't making the mistake of trying to replace Simon Cowell with a facsimile.`` You can't, and it would be foolish to try to do that,'' she says. If you go,` We're going to find another slightly nasty British( recording) executive,' people would reject that because that person would never live up to what Simon Cowell is. That's a recipe for disaster. In our very humble opinion, the only thing you can do is try to create a panel that's entertaining, likable and credible. She's the vision of hope for this country right now. She embodies everything that Barack Obama was trying to say, that we have to be better than we are. He resisted the temptation even as the Nuggets were outscored 34-23 in the third period.`` Our starts in the third quarter are awful,'' George Karl said. I wouldn't even put that in a high school clinic. We come out non-focused, not running. I hope I don't do that( bench the starters), because that could be really ugly. But that is how bad I think our third quarters have been. The first half, though, was what George Karl wants to see. want the Bill Clinton and Congress to work together on the big issues, not least the economy. Larry Sabato said the Republican takeover of the House of Representatives gives the Bill Clinton a new political lease on life. Once the Tea Party members of the House start having a full airing of their views, Barack Obama will appear more moderate. He's going to be nicely positioned between the old Barack Obama and the new Republican House. I've said for more than a year that if the Democrats hold both the House and the Senate Barack Obama might be a one-term Bill Clinton . Now he has someone to blame and someone to make him to look better.
